assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
Firefox 4.2a1pre Crash Report [@ nsDocument::AdoptNode(nsIDOMNode*, nsIDOMNode**)]
This signature is climbing on the 4.2a1pre top crash list, now at #3 for 4.2a1pre.
bp-00148c0f-0a1b-4664-9b4b-d62a02110329
xul.dll nsDocument::AdoptNode content/base/src/nsDocument.cpp:6038 coFFPlgn.dll coFFPlgn.dll@0x18018 cowpplg.dll cowpplg.dll@0x5b610 cowpplg.dll cowpplg.dll@0x48b80 cowpplg.dll cowpplg.dll@0x1ae37 coFFPlgn.dll coFFPlgn.dll@0x2c767 coFFPlgn.dll coFFPlgn.dll@0x2c4be coFFPlgn.dll coFFPlgn.dll@0x3238d coFFPlgn.dll coFFPlgn.dll@0x355ea coFFPlgn.dll coFFPlgn.dll@0x3cf52 xul.dll nsDocLoader::FireOnStateChange uriloader/base/nsDocLoader.cpp:1334 xul.dll nsDocLoader::FireOnStateChange uriloader/base/nsDocLoader.cpp:1341 xul.dll nsDocLoader::FireOnStateChange uriloader/base/nsDocLoader.cpp:1341 xul.dll nsDocLoader::FireOnStateChange uriloader/base/nsDocLoader.cpp:1341 xul.dll nsDocLoader::OnProgress uriloader/base/nsDocLoader.cpp:1110 xul.dll nsHttpChannel::OnTransportStatus netwerk/protocol/http/nsHttpChannel.cpp:4171 xul.dll nsHttpChannel::OnDataAvailable netwerk/protocol/http/nsHttpChannel.cpp:4126 xul.dll nsInputStreamPump::OnStateTransfer netwerk/base/src/nsInputStreamPump.cpp:510
The user comment says: "It's Norton Tool bar 5.5 extension that is the problem."
I looked at a dozen or so crash incidents and they all have coFFPlgn.dll and/or coWPPlg.dll on the stack which appears to be associated with some Norton plugin/extension.
Do we have a contact at Symantec(?) we should notify?
